title: Proximity Sensor seems to work incorrectly.
content:
I have a pixel 3a running Android 10.
I am one of the many people who seem to have problems with the proximity sensor.

The sensor hardware seems to be working properly â€“ when I move my finger toward the top of the screen the display turns off. I have run an AndroSensor app and it shows the normal value for the sensor is 2.0 and I suppose it goes to 0 when I move my finger to the top of the screen and the display turns off.

But, the sensor turns off the display whether I am in a phone call or not. That doesn't seem right.

The display should only be shut off when I'm in a phone call using the earpiece speaker.

The auto off should be disabled if I'm in a phone call using the speaker-phone speaker.
The auto off should also be disabled if I'm not in a phone call.
It would also be nice to have a setting which disables the auto off function altogether.

I have seen in other threads that there is a way, via developer options, to disable all sensors. There should really be a separate way to disable only the proximity sensor.

I have read that there are Android software problems with the proximity sensor. What is the intended way for the sensor to operate?
